Name: SQL - Deploy DACPAC using SqlPackage
Description:
Calls SqlPackage commands such as:
 * [Deploy](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/tools/sqlpackage/sqlpackage-publish?view=sql-server-ver16)
 * [Script](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/tools/sqlpackage/sqlpackage-script?view=sql-server-ver16)
 * [DeployReport](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/tools/sqlpackage/sqlpackage-deploy-drift-report?view=sql-server-ver16)

As SqlPackage is cross-platform, this template is both Windows and Linux* compatible.

Results of `Deploy script` and `deploy report` options will upload to Octopus Deploy as an artifact. This allows you to put in place a manual intervention step if required. It is also useful for auditing purposes.

SqlCmd variables are now supported.  To specify SqlCmd variables, create your Octopus variable with the following naming convention: SqlCmdVariable.<Variable name> (case insensitive) and then assign it a value.  Examples:
* SqlCmdVariable.Variable1
* my.sqlcmdvariable.variable2

NOTE: 
 - Requires version 2019.10 or above. 
 - `TrustServerCertificate=true` is set by default
 - Requires PowerShell or *PowerShell Core

Parameters.Name: DACPACPackageName
Parameters.Label: DACPACPackageName
Parameters.HelpText: The name of the .dacpac file that contains the SSDT model.  Include the .dacpac extensions.  To use a specific folder, use the relative location ex: dacpac/mydacpac.dacpac

Parameters.Name: DACPACPublishProfile
Parameters.Label: Publish profile file name
Parameters.HelpText: Searches the package for the specified file name.  To use a specific folder, use the relative location ex: publish/publish-profile.xml

Parameters.Name: DACPACReport
Parameters.Label: Report
Parameters.HelpText: Whether a deployment report should be generated and loaded into OctopusDeploy as an artifact

Parameters.Name: DACPACScript
Parameters.Label: Script
Parameters.HelpText: Whether a deploy script should be generated and loaded into OctopusDeploy as an artifact

Parameters.Name: DACPACDeploy
Parameters.Label: Deploy
Parameters.HelpText: Whether a deployment of the dacpac should occur

Parameters.Name: DACPACTargetServer
Parameters.Label: Target Servername
Parameters.HelpText: Name of the server to target this deployment against

Parameters.Name: DACPACTargetDatabase
Parameters.Label: Target Database
Parameters.HelpText: Name of the database to target this deployment against

Parameters.Name: DACPACAuthenticationType
Parameters.Label: Authentication type
Parameters.HelpText: Select the method to authenticate to the SQL Server.

DisplaySettings.Octopus.SelectOptions:
SqlAuthentication|SQL Authentication
WindowsIntegrated|Windows Integrated
AzureADManaged|Azure Active Directory Managed Identity
AzureADPassword|Azure Active Directory Username/Password
AzureADIntegrated|Azure Active Directory Integrated
AzureADServicePrincipal|Azure Active Directory Service Principal

Parameters.Name: DACPACSQLUsername
Parameters.Label: Username
Parameters.HelpText:
User name to use to connect to the server if we are not using Integrated Security.

If using the Azure Active Directory Service Principal Authentication Type, use the Azure Account variable here. For example, if your Azure Account variable is called MyAccount, the value for this input would be `#{MyAccount.Client}`

Parameters.Name: DACPACSQLPassword
Parameters.Label: Password
Parameters.HelpText:
Password to use to connect to the server if we are not using Integrated Security.

If using the Azure Active Directory Service Principal Authentication Type, use the Azure Account variable here. For example, if your Azure Account variable is called MyAccount, the value for this input would be `#{MyAccount.Password}`

Parameters.Name: DACPACPackage
Parameters.Label: DACPAC Package
Parameters.HelpText: The package containing the `.dacpac` file from the specified repository.

Parameters.Name: DACPACCommandTimeout
Parameters.Label: Command Timeout
Parameters.HelpText: Override the default command timeout for longer-running scripts.

Parameters.Name: DACPACExeLocation
Parameters.Label: SqlPackage executable location
Parameters.HelpText:
Location of the SqlPackage executable. Leave blank to dynamically download.
Examples:
Embedded within the package:`#{Octopus.Action.Package[DACPACPackage].ExtractedPath}/MySubFolder`
On disk:`c:\sqlpackage\sqlpackage.exe` or `/etc/sqlpackage/sqlpackage`

Parameters.Name: DACPACAdditionalArguments
Parameters.Label: Additional arguments
Parameters.HelpText: A comma-delimited list of additional arguments to add to the SqlPackage command.
